e-Discovery?  What's that? [SEP] Roughly, it is the view that there are independent moral standards: some actions are right or wrong in themselves, independent of God's commands.

e-Discovery?  What's that? [SEP] Thus he contends that not even God can change the Ten Commandments (adding, however, that God can change what individuals deserve in particular cases, in what might look like special dispensations to murder or steal).

Tell me about some of the wonders in Asia [SEP] The lyric is a basic plea for sex -- 'Rock me all night long' -- while the music provides a blues structure that allows King room for biting guitar work.

Tell me about some of the wonders in Asia [SEP] 'Rock Me Baby' was released as a single on Kent in the spring of 1964 and climbed into the Top 20 of the R&B charts and the Top 40 of the pop charts, making it King's biggest crossover hit yet and his most successful pop record until the appearance of 'The Thrill Is Gone' five and a half years later.

[SEP] Ancient Rocks of Grand Canyon Most rocks in Grand Canyon are sedimentary rocks, which form when sediments such as sand, silt, or mud gather in thick layers that, over time, are compressed into rock.

[SEP] Grand Canyon’s sedimentary rock layers accumulated over millions of years on the prehistoric surface of northern Arizona, which has been home to giant sand dunes, muddy river deltas, and shallow tropical seas over the past 500 million years.

[SEP] A ponzi scheme is a scheme in which the party perpetrating the fraud does the following: Receives cash or property from investors; Purports to earn income for the investors and reports to the investors income amounts that are wholly or partially fictitious; Makes payments, if any, of purported income or principal to investors from cash or property that other investors invested in the fraudulent arrangement; and Criminally appropriates (the party perpetrating the fraud) some or all of the investors' cash or property.

Why do open cycle rocket engines exhaust fuel? [SEP] Newton's Third Law of Motion                 Sir Isaac Newton first presented his three laws of motion in the 'Principia Mathematica Philosophiae Naturalis' in 1686.
Why do open cycle rocket engines exhaust fuel? [SEP] His third law states that for every action (force) in nature there is an equal and opposite reaction.
Why do open cycle rocket engines exhaust fuel? [SEP] In other words, if object A exerts a force on object B, then object B also exerts an equal and opposite force on object A.
Why do open cycle rocket engines exhaust fuel? [SEP] Notice that the forces are exerted on different objects.
Why do open cycle rocket engines exhaust fuel? [SEP] In aerospace engineering, the principal of action and reaction is very important.
Why do open cycle rocket engines exhaust fuel? [SEP] Newton's third law explains the generation of thrust by a rocket engine.
Why do open cycle rocket engines exhaust fuel? [SEP] In a rocket engine, hot exhaust gas is produced through the combustion of a fuel with an oxidizer.
Why do open cycle rocket engines exhaust fuel? [SEP] The hot exhaust gas flows through the rocket nozzle and is accelerated to the rear of the rocket.
Why do open cycle rocket engines exhaust fuel? [SEP] In re-action, a thrusting force is produced on the engine mount.
Why do open cycle rocket engines exhaust fuel? [SEP] The thrust accelerates the rocket as described by Newton's second law of motion.

OK, and what can I do to make my bike more comfortable? [SEP] But you’ll find plenty of aluminum touring bikes on the market, and an increasing number of carbon frames, too, although repairing a carbon frame in rural wherever isn’t really an option.

OK, and what can I do to make my bike more comfortable? [SEP] You can find titanium touring bikes too, which are notably expensive, but they’re tough and light, and the vibration damping can be a godsend on rough roads and dirt.
OK, and what can I do to make my bike more comfortable? [SEP] Touring Bike Geometry There are a handful of subtle differences within touring bike geometries that set them apart from road bikes.
OK, and what can I do to make my bike more comfortable? [SEP] Touring geometry is more upright, creating a riding position that’s more comfortable during long hours in the saddle.
OK, and what can I do to make my bike more comfortable? [SEP] You’ll see different bike companies refer to this as their “endurance” or “adventure” geometry.
OK, and what can I do to make my bike more comfortable? [SEP] This “endurance” geometry plays out in a handful of different ways.

OK, and what can I do to make my bike more comfortable? [SEP] The wheelbase and chainstay of a classic touring bike is typically longer to make room for rear racks and panniers, and the bottom bracket is typically lower to increase stability.

OK, and what can I do to make my bike more comfortable? [SEP] The head tube is typically longer on a touring bike, essentially elevating the handlebar, and there’s more slack, helping to extend the wheelbase.

OK, and what can I do to make my bike more comfortable? [SEP] Touring bikes also generally have a shorter top tube, or more important, a shorter “reach,” which is the distance from the center of the bottom bracket to the top of the head tube.

What’s the best bike seat [SEP] Comfort depends on riding position.
What’s the best bike seat [SEP] With comfort bikes and hybrids, cyclists sit high over the seat, their weight directed down onto the saddle, such that a wider and more cushioned saddle is preferable.

What’s the best bike seat [SEP] For racing bikes where the rider is bent over, weight is more evenly distributed between the handlebars and saddle, the hips are flexed, and a narrower and harder saddle is more efficient.

[SEP] Qualifications for a Technology Job | Work - Chron.com Qualifications for a Technology Job Work | Career Advice | Job Qualifications By Chron Contributor Updated August 27, 2020 A technology career provides you with long-term job security in today's environment, but experience and formal information technology qualifications, as well as keeping current on changes in the industry, makes you sought-after by employers.

What’s another tip to break into the tech industry asides from having relevant qualifications? [SEP] However, you also have a lot of competition for the many technology jobs that become available as employers can pick from a wide range of applicants.

What’s another tip to break into the tech industry asides from having relevant qualifications? [SEP] Types of Information Technology Jobs  According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, information technology jobs include systems analysts, programmers and computer support specialists.

What’s another tip to break into the tech industry asides from having relevant qualifications? [SEP] Businesses and educational institutions often look for programmers, analysts and support specialists in the information technology, or IT, field.

In terms of their ranking though, how do search engines rank items? [SEP] The advertiser in question could have specified that the ad only been shown to certain users for a whole host of reasons, or the advertiser could have specified that the ad only show on certain third-party sites.

In terms of their ranking though, how do search engines rank items? [SEP] “Advertisers can choose to target the audience they want to reach, and we have policies that guide the type of interest-based ads that are allowed,” reads a statement from Google.

In terms of their ranking though, how do search engines rank items? [SEP] The interesting thing about the fake users in the Ad Fisher study, however, is that they had entirely fresh search histories: In fact, the accounts used were more or less identical, except for their listed gender identity.

In terms of their ranking though, how do search engines rank items? Okay, but how did “Good Morning, Vietnam” help the sales of What a Wonderful World” [SEP] The following year, he was recruited to join the U.S. Army Intelligence Corps and trained at Fort Holabird, Maryland.

Okay, but how did “Good Morning, Vietnam” help the sales of What a Wonderful World” [SEP] Then he was assigned to the 519th MI Battalion in Miami, Florida, where he interviewed Cuban refugees fleeing Fidel Castro’s government.

Okay, but how did “Good Morning, Vietnam” help the sales of What a Wonderful World” [SEP] During the last six months of his enlistment, his unit was deployed to Vietnam, where he joined Armed Forces Radio-Saigon and met the station’s program director, Airman Adrian Cronauer.

Okay, but how did “Good Morning, Vietnam” help the sales of What a Wonderful World” [SEP] Their close friendship resulted in Moses' decision to write the story of their experiences at Armed Forces Radio – Saigon, which he titled 'Good Morning, Vietnam'  Section::::Television career.

Okay, but how did “Good Morning, Vietnam” help the sales of What a Wonderful World” [SEP] After the Army, Moses' first network television job was in 1970 as a camera assistant for CBS on 'The Jackie Gleason Show' in Miami Beach.

Okay, but how did “Good Morning, Vietnam” help the sales of What a Wonderful World” [SEP] He married Andrea Duda, one of the show's dancers, and they moved to New York, where in 1971 he became a producer for Young & Rubicam Advertising.

Okay, but how did “Good Morning, Vietnam” help the sales of What a Wonderful World” [SEP] Eighteen months later he joined General Electric as executive in charge of television programming and production for the company’s new 'General Electric Theatre' series of TV documentaries and movies, one of which -– “The Wolfmen”—received an Academy Award.

Okay, but how did “Good Morning, Vietnam” help the sales of What a Wonderful World” [SEP] Turns out, that excerpt happens to be one of the most lively sections of the memoir.

Okay, but how did “Good Morning, Vietnam” help the sales of What a Wonderful World” [SEP] Baker's book made its way onto my independent reading list for 9-10th grade students, so I found it at a sale and picked it up to read myself.

Okay, but how did “Good Morning, Vietnam” help the sales of What a Wonderful World” [SEP] It's an 'okay' biography and Baker is a pleasant companion, but I wonder how much today's high school students will identify with this boy-to-man equivalent of Wonder Bread.

[SEP] Net neutrality  Network neutrality, or simply net neutrality, is the principle that Internet service providers (ISPs) must treat all Internet communications equally, and not discriminate or charge differently based on user, content, website, platform, application, type of equipment, or method of communication.
Um, what is search neutrality? [SEP] With net neutrality, ISPs may not intentionally block, slow down, or charge money for specific online content.

Um, what is search neutrality? [SEP] Without net neutrality, ISPs may prioritize certain types of traffic, meter others, or potentially block traffic from specific services, while charging consumers for various tiers of service.

Um, what is search neutrality? [SEP] The term was coined by Columbia University media law professor Tim Wu in 2003, as an extension of the longstanding concept of a common carrier, which was used to describe the role of telephone systems.
